channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Belvedere commission backs zoning changes for new housing
item.description: The Planning Commission unanimously recommended zoning changes that would accommodate at least 160 new housing units
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel

item.title: Improvements aim to protect Tiburon students and rec center visitors
item.description: Plans include new sidewalks, retaining walls and curb gutters; high-visibility crosswalks, yield lines and stencils; new signage; relocated fencing; and extending drainage culverts.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Documentary traces mountain lion's trek through Tiburon and beyond
item.description: The film is streaming online through Oct. 30 as part of the 2025 Green Film Festival of San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon fishing boats quiet their bullhorns after noise complaints
item.description: A monthslong noise dispute between Tiburon residents and fishing-charter captains appears to be easing, with one captain saying he halted early-morning bullhorn use that neighbors say disrupted their sleep. Earlier this month, Tiburon police received a call reporting an “ongoing issue with boats continuing to use megaphones” in the area of Keil Cove, according to dispatch logs. Marin County Sheriff’s Office Sgt. Adam Schermerhorn confirmed his office has also received a complaint. ...
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Three dozen Tiburon streets are slated for 2026 upgrades
item.description: Nearly three dozen Tiburon streets east of Trestle Glen Boulevard are slated for repairs next year. The Town Council voted unanimously at its Oct. 15 meeting to approve a $121,220 contract with San Luis Obispo-headquartered Pavement Engineering Inc. to design the annual street rehabilitation project. The work will cover 6.54 miles of roads. Funding for the design work was included as part of the town’s capital-improvement program for fiscal year 2025-2026. The streets, all of which need...
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Father-and-son Tiburon rowers share bond while tackling Boston’s iconic Head of the Charles
item.description: The Tiburon father and son competed in the Directors’ Challenge Parent/Child Doubles race during the 2025 Head of the Charles Regatta.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A Bay Area local shows East Coast friend the Golden State
item.description: It was the first time in Tiburon for both, one of several stops on Danser’s trip from New York City to visit Yang, who lives in San Jose.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon Town Hall exhibits feature multimedia collages, oil paintings
item.description: Tiburon Heritage and Arts Commissioner Jaleh Etemad and Larkspur resident Debra Maddox are each exhibiting their works at Town Hall starting in November.
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith
